entry.title: Reland "Autocomplete unrecognized FillAfterSuggestion funnel metric."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 4b2366b7114b3a23b2ebd807c4c885282c9132a0



crrev.com/c/4721230 landed right before the original CL, causing

the FillAfterSuggestion_Filled test to fail to compile.

Renamed RendererFormDataAction to AutofillActionPersistence in the test.



Original change's description:

> Autocomplete unrecognized FillAfterSuggestion funnel metric.

>

> Implements the second metric defined in [1]. It measures whether users

> accepted any suggestions on an ac=unrecognized fields given that they

> saw suggestion on an ac=unrecognized field. On desktop, this can happen

> through manual fallback - and on mobile it can happen as per

> crrev.com/c/4711348. As outlined in the doc, for comparability with the existing FillAfterSuggestion funnel metric, the

> new metric is emitted on navigation.

>

> The implementation uses the AutocompleteUnrecognizedFallbackEventLogger

> to track a newly introduced SuggestionState. For this reasons, events

> are emitted from the BAM to the suggestion loggers when a suggestion is

> shown or accepted. This logic is not behind a feature flag, because

> the code can only be reached when the manual fallback or the feature

> for mobile are enabled.

>

> [1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lb346eaee6GfQ6iDbPH44hz_VwyPcpj9Pj-2O2TK9vE/edit?resourcekey=0-hW0oTZZhhiGLiQEu81ptfA#heading=h.4q6kyji0si8l

>

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2/V4L2StatefulVD: Don't use TryFormat() during init
entry.content:
ToT has to EnumeratePixelLayoutCandidates() during |CAPTURE_queue_|

initialization. For this, it calls TryFormat() (VIDIOC_TRY_FMT), in

the same fashion as V4L2VideoDecoder [1]. On QC venus (trogdor), this

VIDIOC_TRY_FMT seems to work as expected, but on Hana MT8173, it just

seems to return incorrect numbers, e.g. in the VP8 test set many

test vectors are 176x160, which should be supported directly, yet the

Try call returns 192x192. (ToT might be broken since the combination

of V4L2VideoDecoder and Hana's ImageProcessor was never launched

and failed to validate md5sums anyway).



With this change (and a couple of logging improvements), most of the

VP8 and VP9 test vectors pass MD5SUM verification on Hana (and they

don't regress on trogdor). Those that don't [2] have the quality of

being of a resolution (e.g. 176x144) not directly supported by Hana

hardware, IOW they need to have a "crop" or "visible_rect" on top of

a larger buffer resolution (176x160). Visually they are fine though,

but MD5SUM verification fails. To be further investigated.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/gpu/v4l2/v4l2_video_decoder.cc;l=483;drc=2b18cb8166aa734721a7702b0ea4e47b1131bb7d

[2] (vp80-00-comprehensive-002/010/013/015.ivf and

vp80-03-segmentation-1436/1425.ivf

entry.title: variations: Add SafeSeedManager override for CrOS
entry.content:
CrOS early boot needs to have its own notion of what the "safe seed" is

(and when to use it). Create a SafeSeedManager interface and a new

override that implements only necessary functionality for CrOS devices.



Specifically, override the GetSeedType method to return the seed type

passed in the constructor. The logic to determine which seed to use

will be done in featured, which will exec the evaluate_seed binary.

The new class will be passed to other variations methods like

VariationsFieldTrialCreatorBase::CreateTrialsFromSeed().

entry.title: [GM3] Set UserColor instead of AutogeneratedColor when GM3
entry.content:
With GM3 we are no longer using BuildAutogeneratedThemeFromColor. It

still technically works, but it sets a GM2 theme instead of GM3 theme,

which we want to avoid.



This came to my attention because of profile creation giving a random

GM2 theme with sync off. This is kept pretty simple with just swapping

to the new ThemeService method for setting a theme color when the flag

for ChromeRefresh2023 is enabled.



I don't know much about this section of the code base. There may be

some complexity I am missing. It does seem to at least fix the issue

that brought this to my attention. If something is missing, please let

me know and I'll fix it or someone from the SignIn team can, if they

would prefer.

entry.title: Collect and shard tests in wrapper layer of run_wpt_tests.py
entry.content:
This uses the same way to collect and shard tests as in RWT. We then

dynamically build subsuite config file, pass the config file and the

tests to Wptrunner. Wptrunner will not do any sharding and

always run all the tests passed in.



The benefits are:

1) This automatically get all the features for test collection

from RWT, e.g. --smoke, command line auto expansion.

2) This lifts the need to add additional functionalities for subsuite

support in Wptrunner, including run individual test from a subsuite,

sharding for subsuite tests.

entry.title: Speculative fix for using an old window token.
entry.content:
A deferred update to the action buttons for a pip window is, in some

cases, using a window token that's not valid anymore. The only path

I could find where this might happen is if the window is closed from

the native side.



When that happens, the native side unsubscribes from android

lifecycle callbacks (via WindowAndroid), but doesn't cancel the

deferred update. While a later call from java to native to

indicate destruction would clear the java ref and prevent the

callback from happening, that's specifically avoided in the

java side for close actions that start on the native side.



The speculative fix is simple: stop the timer for the deferred

action button updates when the native side initiates close. It's

unclear if we should also clear the java ref at this point, but

cancelling the timer should be sufficient so starting with that.

entry.content:
Adds the metadata for ChromeOS.AnomalousProcCount.ForbiddenIntersection.

This metrics records the number of processes on the system that do not

have the minimum sandboxing criteria to be clear of the forbidden

intersection:

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromiumos/docs/+/HEAD/sandboxing.md#The-Forbidden-Intersection

regular metric, as the descriptions for each subcategory is different

enough.

entry.title: [Pcct] Extend the closing animation end position
entry.content:
Closing animation was stopped short before it goes over the system UI

area. This exposes the system-driven animation starting from the

position where the custom animation stopped, giving an effect of

animation hanging momentarily or the animation changing the direction.

This CL extends the custom closing animation end position to the

screen end to fix the visual artifact.

entry.title: Don't reset global filter when entering layers.
entry.content:
Layers should only reset states that are applied on the layer output, to

make sure that these states are not applied twice, once inside the layer

and once outside. The global filter however is not applied on the

filter's output so there is no reason to reset it in the layer.

entry.title: FilePathWatcher: Revamp how unit tests are evaluated
entry.content:
This CL introduces a more detailed and extendable strategy for

expecting events from a base::FilePathWatcher. It does not add,

remove, nor change the file system operations performed in any

of the existing tests.



Before: expect that _some_ event was received

After: use matchers to expect that specific events were received,

determined by the file system operation performed



This lays the groundwork for supporting event types in

FilePathWatcher. The matchers may later be extended to expect

entry.title: [iOS] alertCoordinator is stopped
entry.content:
According to ChromeCoordinator invariant, all coordinators should be

stopped before being deallocated. This CL ensures that whatever the user

chose, the coordinator is stopped; whether they tap a button or

dismiss by tapping outside (which call the cancel button)



In ActionSheetCoordinator, a cancel item is always added.

ensuring it stops the coordinator

entry.title: Simplify AutofillContextMenuManager manager + driver lookups.
entry.content:
Instead of passing around the RenderFrameHost and retrieving/null

checking the driver and manager manually in every function, this CL

passes around the manager and driver instead.

Since every lookup of the manager and driver is a map lookup, this is

less expensive. It's also easier to read, since the manager and driver

are passed around by reference, guaranteeing that they are non-null.



This is a follow-up to this discussion: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4742420/comment/56ac4f28_7db1c306/

entry.title: Autocomplete unrecognized FillAfterSuggestion funnel metric.
entry.content:
Implements the second metric defined in [1]. It measures whether users

accepted any suggestions on an ac=unrecognized fields given that they

saw suggestion on an ac=unrecognized field. On desktop, this can happen

through manual fallback - and on mobile it can happen as per

crrev.com/c/4711348. As outlined in the doc, for comparability with the existing FillAfterSuggestion funnel metric, the

new metric is emitted on navigation.



The implementation uses the AutocompleteUnrecognizedFallbackEventLogger

to track a newly introduced SuggestionState. For this reasons, events

are emitted from the BAM to the suggestion loggers when a suggestion is

shown or accepted. This logic is not behind a feature flag, because

the code can only be reached when the manual fallback or the feature

for mobile are enabled.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lb346eaee6GfQ6iDbPH44hz_VwyPcpj9Pj-2O2TK9vE/edit?resourcekey=0-hW0oTZZhhiGLiQEu81ptfA#heading=h.4q6kyji0si8l



Bug: 1446318

Change-Id: I3061218e4949f733de4aedd4f8498a10d7f093e7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4747739

entry.title: Derive the fixture classes from `WithParamInterface`
entry.content:
By deriving the fixture classes from `WithParamInterface` instead of

`TestWithParam`, this allows `AppCommandRunnerTestBase` to derive from

`Test`, and allows for `SetUp` and `TearDown` to be in

`AppCommandRunnerTestBase`.



This is a follow-up to crrev/1179926, which was using the

`AppCommandRunnerTestBase` constructor/destructor to run the `SetUp` and

`TearDown` code. In that CL, `AppCommandRunnerTestBase` could not derive

`AppCommandRunnerTestBase` from `Test` because the fixture classes were

deriving from `Test`, which was not ideal.

entry.title: [FPS] Handle sites without registrable domains/TLDs forgivingly
entry.content:
Previously, we would ignore some types of errors (considering them to

be nonfatal), but if any of those errors resulted in a singleton set,

then we considered that to be a fatal error. This would have the

effect of nullifying the entire list of sets.



Instead, we should be somewhat forgiving for errors that can arise

over time and aren't under the full control of the FPS data source

that is being parsed. In particular, we can drop sites (not entire

sets) that don't have a valid eTLD+1; and we can drop individual

invalid sets without invalidating the entire list of sets in some

situations (e.g. for singleton sets).

entry.title: Fallback to native element role for certain landmarks when no specific name is provided
entry.content:
The 'form without label' subtest[1] is failing in web platform tests.

According to the ARIA spec[2], certain landmark roles like form or

region require names from authors. If an author has not specified names

for these landmarks, it is considered an author error and treated such

elements as if no role had been provided.



[1]: https://wpt.fyi/results/wai-aria/role/form-roles.html

[2]: https://w3c.github.io/aria/#document-handling_author-errors_roles

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] The prefs are resettable by a FeatureParam
entry.content:
The new pref LocalPasswordMigrationWarningResetCount is used to track

how many times the migration warning prefs have been reset from the

server side. The prefs get reset when the FeatureParam

entry.title: ImageBitmap: Decode high bit depth images as high bit depth
entry.content:
blink::ImageDecoder supports decoding to kN32_SkColorType (via the

parameter kDefaultBitDepth) and to kRGBA_F16_SkColorType (via the

parameter kHighBitDepthToHalfFloat).



If a cc::PaintImage reports kRGBA_F16_SkColorType as its SkColorType,

then decode it using the kHighBitDepthToHalfFloat parameter. This

prevents premature excessive quantization of high bit depth images.

taken into account when removing the `transitionend` listener in

display_manager.js.

the `AddEventListenerOptions` parameter of `addEventListener()`

instead of calling `removeEventListener()` with a different function

reference than the one used in `addEventListener()`.

entry.title: Emit ExplicitlyTriggered metric on navigation.
entry.content:
The metric measures the acceptance of the manual fallback option in the

context menu. Currently, it is emitted every time the context menu is closed. It was now decided [1] to emit manual fallback related metrics

on navigation, once per page, so they are comparable to key and funnel

metrics.



Generally, key and funnel metrics are emitted through the

AddressFormEventLogger. It is a member of BrowserAutofillManager,

which listens to the various form events and emits metrics on

destruction. For autocomplete=unrecognized fields, the address form

event logger is not used, however [2].



In order to collect metrics for autocomplete=unrecognized fields in

the same event logger style, this CL introduces the

AutocompleteUnrecognizedFallbackEventLogger. In particular, it:

- Renames AutocompleteUnrecognizedFallbackMetricLogger to

AutocompleteUnrecognizedFallbackEventLogger.

- Makes it a member of BrowserAutofillManager (it used to be a

member of the context menu manager).

- Moves the metric emission logic to the destructor of the logger.

- Adapts the metric according to [1].

- Remove the context menu manager's OnMenuClosed() override.



In follow-up CLs, the AutocompleteUnrecognizedFallbackEventLogger will

be integrated with the existing event loggers to listen to the form

events. This will make it possible to implement the second metric

defined in [1].



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lb346eaee6GfQ6iDbPH44hz_VwyPcpj9Pj-2O2TK9vE/edit?resourcekey=0-hW0oTZZhhiGLiQEu81ptfA#heading=h.4q6kyji0si8l

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/browser_autofill_manager.cc;l=3616-3623;drc=c261a8e1af9f81733065f72610f2b7d9c5b0ba0c



Bug: 1446318

entry.title: Add CloudIdentifier to FileSystemProvider's metadata
entry.content:
We are adding a new method getCloudIdentifiers() to the file system

access web API's FileSystemHandle. That method will retrieve "cloud

identifiers", i.e. an identifier for the provider (e.g.

"drive.google.com") and that file's/directory's unique identifier used

by the provider. Chrome will fetch these from the sync client

responsible for the given file/directory (e.g. DriveFSService for

GoogleDrive on CrOS or an external sync service on Windows/Mac/Linux).

PWAs using that new method can then work with the file/directory

directly from the cloud storage instead of working with the local

file/directory.



For files/directories provided via the chrome.fileSystemProvider API on

ChromeOS (e.g. OneDrive integration), the extension/app providing the

file system is also the responsible sync client that can provide these

cloud identifiers.

In this case, Chrome will request that data from the file system

provider via the existing mechanism to request metadata, which the file

system provider will receive as

chrome.fileSystemProvider.onGetMetadataRequested event.



relevant DD section (Google-internal only):

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o0IX4vmJK_QdX0dr4hulov5V6IWrOIovUKuU93GdJxg/edit#bookmark=id.3ews4i65a26n



Bug: 1443354, b:279580265

entry.title: Fix VRR-induced video lag
entry.content:
This CL resolves an issue where videos lag as though they are rendering

in background mode, which is triggered by either of the

`enable-variable-refresh-rate` or `disable-frame-rate-limit` flags.



The lagging behavior was caused by a broken contract prescribed by

`BeginFrameObserver` where all `OnBeginFrame` calls must be matched by

corresponding `DidFinishFrame` calls. Failing to fulfill the contract

means the `BackToBackBeginFrameSource` cannot trigger any begin frame

after the first. This change adds the missing `DidFinishFrame` call to

`FrameSinkBundleImpl::Submit`.



BUG=b:291966244



Change-Id: I2248835e8764f1a39418f60f5257a2596a8aa0d8

entry.title: Fix logging of SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.{IsMainframe} for iOS
entry.content:
Since `url_lookup_service_metric_suffix` is empty for iOS, the histogram

SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.{IsMainframe} was being logged twice.

This CL avoids the second log when the suffix is empty.



Other changes in this CL:

- URT test cases now validate the SafeBrowsing.RT.LocalMatch.Result.*

metrics.

- A new test case is added for an URT non-mainframe lookup.

- A new test case is added for the specific bug (suffix = empty).

- The test method CreateSafeBrowsingUrlChecker is refactored to take in

a struct for optional args instead of individual optional parameters.

This is so that test cases don't need to fill in the default values

for irrelevant params when they want to set the value for another

optional param.

component registration priority.



See crbug.com/1466862. Add a feature flag that enables the use of

USER_VISIBLE as the component registration priority. This feature is

off by default. By comparing the metrics on how many Privacy Sandbox

APIs are rejected because of the attestations map is not ready, we can

determine whether it is worth using the higher priority USER_VISIBLE,

which will regress the startup time.



TLDR:

1. For fresh install no difference USER_VISIBLE v.s. BEST_EFFORT.

2. If attestations file is already installed from previous run:

- USER_VISIBLE: component will be ready right after Chrome starts.

- BEST_EFFORT: component will take similar amount of time to be ready

as if it's fresh install.



Also I don't observe difference between USER_BLOCKING and USER_VISIBLE.



Bug: 1466862, 1464226

Change-Id: I66366a797795707d18c363068cb84783ef3175a0

entry.title: Merge profile token quality when merging profiles.
entry.content:
During import, deduplication and when receiving updates through Sync (

and probably some other cases), Autofill profiles are merged. In this

case, the profiles' token_quality() needs to be merged accordingly.



This CL adds AutofillProfile::MergeFormGroupTokenQuality() to do that.

Depending on where the merged value came from (profile A, profile B, or

neither in case of a "proper" merge), observations are either retained,

carried over or reset.



Bug: 1453650

entry.title: Don't try to add same modules again from libunwindstack unwinder
entry.content:
Sometimes we are trying to add same modules again to module cache

causing crashes. One of the reasons is we still try to add frames when

libunwindstack returns with some error code, in the hope of adding the

partially unwound stack frame. With this change we won't try to add

same modules again to cache and stopping these crashes. Also adding a

trace event to further understand these crashes in field.



Bug: 1446766

entry.title: Implement phase 1 of cloud file handling
entry.content:
`getCloudIdentifiers()` is a new method for the `FileSystemHandle`,

which will retrieve "cloud file handles" (`provider_name` and `id`) for

the given local file/directory if it is synced with cloud storage (e.g.

GoogleDrive or OneDrive) and the syncing client is registered with the

browser. `provider_name` identifies the sync provider (e.g.

"drive.google.com") and `id` is the identifier that provider uses for

the given file/directory.



This CL implements the first phase, i.e. support for GoogleDrive on

ChromeOS. Support for OneDrive on ChromeOS (or any other provider using

the `chrome.fileSystemProvider` API) will follow shortly. Other

platforms/providers will follow in the future.



The change is gated on the blink feature

`FileSystemAccessGetCloudIdentifiers`. A demo website making use of

this new API can be found at https://cloud-file-handling.glitch.me/.



Public explainer:

https://github.com/WICG/file-system-access/blob/main/proposals/CloudIdentifier.md

DD (Google-internal only):

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1o0IX4vmJK_QdX0dr4hulov5V6IWrOIovUKuU93GdJxg/



Bug: 1443354, b:279580265

Change-Id: Id3a802c06b54ce4c9421b002c994a2c0f46372f3

entry.title: Asynchronously kick off all serialization tests
entry.content:
Instead of waiting for each individual test to complete before

starting the next one, we now eagerly start all the tests.



This reduces the test run time by a factor of 1.6× (from 729 ms

down to 454 ms) as observed on my workstation using these

commands:



```

autoninja -C out/Release chrome blink_tests && \

third_party/blink/tools/run_web_tests.py -t Release http/tests/inspector-protocol/runtime/serialization-options.js && \

cat out/Release/layout-test-results/times_ms.json

```



Before:



```

{"http":{"tests":{"inspector-protocol":{"runtime":{"serialization-options.js":729}}}}}

```



After:



```

{"http":{"tests":{"inspector-protocol":{"runtime":{"serialization-options.js":454}}}}}

```



Bug: chromium:1457850

Change-Id: Ife22ef75384959730f61307b411dca97140c6a5d
